resources.string: Borshch (sometimes written as borsch, borsht, or borshch) is a sour soup with distinctive red colour. Usually, the ingredients are meat, beetroots, cabbage, carrots, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes. It is traditionally done with smetana (sour cream), pampushky (tiny garlic buns), garlic, onion, and salo (pork lard).
Varenyky are made of dough and different fillings, such as meat, potatoes, mushrooms, vegetables, fruits, cheese, or berries. Their fillings can be salty or sweet, lean or meaty.
Chicken Kyiv is a chicken filet fried with a piece of butter and herbs inside. It usually is served with mashed potatoes and vegetable salad.
